title: and 89 (inserted by section 15 of the Protection of the Environment Act 2003
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Environmental Protection
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Environmental Protection 

Agency (Industrial Emissions) (Licensing) (Amendment) Regulations 2020.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited environmental protection agency (industrial emissions) (licensing) (amendment) regulation 2020

title: and 89 (inserted by section 15 of the Protection of the Environment Act 2003
heading: In these Regulations -
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations - 

“Act of 1992” means the Environmental Protection Agency Act 1992 
(No. 7 of 1992); 

“Principal Regulations” means the Environmental Protection Agency 
(Industrial Emissions) (Licensing) Regulations 2013 (S.I. 137 of 2013).
text_norm: 2 regulation - act 1992 mean environmental protection agency act 1992 (no 7 1992) principal regulation mean environmental protection agency (industrial emissions) (licensing) regulation 2013 (s.i 137 2013)

title: and 89 (inserted by section 15 of the Protection of the Environment Act 2003
heading: 3. The Principal Regulations are amended –
text_raw:
3. The Principal Regulations are amended – 

(a) by the substitution of “environmental impact assessment report” 
for “environmental impact statement” in each place that it 
occurs, and 

(b) by 

the substitution of “environmental 

impact assessment 
reports” for “environmental impact statements” in each place 
that it occurs.
text_norm: 3 principal regulation amended - (a) substitution environmental impact assessment report environmental impact statement place occurs (b) substitution environmental impact assessment report environmental impact statement place occurs

title: and 89 (inserted by section 15 of the Protection of the Environment Act 2003
heading: 4. Regulation 2 of the Principal Regulations is amended-
text_raw:
4. Regulation 2 of the Principal Regulations is amended- 

(a) by the insertion of the following definition after the definition of 

“application for permission”: 

1 OJ No. L 26, 28.1.2012, p. 1 
2 OJ No. L 124, 25.4.2014, p. 1 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 29th May, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [190] 3 

“EIA Directive” means Directive 2011/92/EU of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 13 December 20113 as 
amended by Directive 2014/52/EU of the European Parliament 
and of the Council of 16 April 20144; 

and 

(b) by the deletion of the definition of “Planning and Development 

Regulations”.

title: and 89 (inserted by section 15 of the Protection of the Environment Act 2003
heading: 5. Regulation 4 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the insertion
text_raw:
5. Regulation 4 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the insertion 

of the following paragraph after paragraph (1): 

“(2) Where an application is required to be accompanied by an 
environmental impact assessment report the Agency shall - 

(a) publish a copy of the notification provided in accordance 

with Regulation 5 on its website, 

(b) without prejudice 

the 
information referred to in Regulation 5(d)(ii) available 
on its website, at the latest as soon as practicable after - 

to Regulation 18, make 

(i) 

sending a notification under Regulation 11(1), or, 

(ii) 

the case of additional or supplementary 
in 
information requested under paragraph (e), or 
required under paragraph (f)(ii)(II), of section 
the Act of 1992, receiving such 
83(2A) of 
information, 

(c) 

specify on its website, by reference to the date on which 
information is made available under paragraph (b), a 
period, which shall be not less than 30 days, within 
which submissions may be made to it in writing in 
relation to the likely effects on the environment of the 
proposed activity, and 

(d) publish a notification on its website, where it is the case, 
that it appears to the Agency that the activity the subject 
of the application would, or is likely to, have significant 
effects on the environment in another Member State of 
the European Union.”.

title: and 89 (inserted by section 15 of the Protection of the Environment Act 2003
heading: 8. The Principal Regulations are amended by the substitution of the
text_raw:
8. The Principal Regulations are amended by the substitution of the 

following Regulation for Regulation 11: 

“11 

(1) Where the Agency is satisfied that an environmental 
impact assessment report submitted under this Part complies with 
section 83(2A)(dd) of the Act of 1992 the Agency shall notify the 
applicant in writing. 

(2) Where the Agency is not satisfied that an environmental impact 
assessment report submitted under this Part complies with section 
83(2A)(dd) of the Act of 1992 the Agency shall notify the applicant in 
writing and may, as it considers appropriate having regard to the 
circumstances, specify such information or particular as it requires in 
order to so satisfy itself and a time period within which such 
information or particular should be submitted in order for the 
application to be considered further.”.
text_norm: 8 principal regulation amended substitution following regulation regulation 11 11 (1) agency satisfied environmental impact assessment report submitted part complies section 83(2a)(dd) act 1992 agency shall notify applicant writing (2) agency satisfied environmental impact assessment report submitted part complies section 83(2a)(dd) act 1992 agency shall notify applicant writing may considers appropriate regard circumstance specify information particular requires order satisfy time period within information particular submitted order application considered further

title: and 89 (inserted by section 15 of the Protection of the Environment Act 2003
heading: 9. Regulation 15 of the Principal Regulations is amended -
text_raw:
9. Regulation 15 of the Principal Regulations is amended - 

(a) by the substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph (1): 

“(1) Where - 

(a) 

the Agency receives an application, other than 
an application in respect of which a notice in 
accordance with Regulation 10(2)(b)(i) has been 
or will be given and it appears to the Agency 
that the activity, the subject of the application, 
would or is likely to have significant effects on 

 
 
 
 6 [190] 

the environment in another Member State of the 
European Union, or 

(b) 

a Member State of the European Union that is 
likely to be significantly affected by a project to 
be carried out in the State which is the subject 
of an application for a licence so requests, 

the Agency shall, as soon as may be after receipt of the 
application or request, notify 
the appropriate competent 
authority in the Member State concerned in accordance with 
paragraphs (3) and (4).”, 

(b) by the substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph (2): 

“(2) The Agency shall notify the Minister of any notification 
given in accordance with paragraph (1).”, 

(c) 

by the substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph (3): 

“(3) A notification given under paragraph (1) shall contain 
the information specified in paragraphs (a) to (e) (other than 
paragraph (d)(iv)) of Regulation 5 in relation to the activity the 
subject of the application, together with any information 
available on the activity’s possible transboundary impact.”, 

(d) by the substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph (4): 

“(4) The Agency shall specify in the notification given under 
paragraph (1) a reasonable period of time during which the 
Member State concerned may indicate whether or not it wishes 
to participate 
environmental decision-making 
procedure.”, 

the 

in 

(e) 

by the substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph (5): 

“(5) Where a Member State of the European Union that has 
been sent a notification under paragraph (1) indicates that it 
intends to participate in the environmental decision-making 
procedure, the Agency shall, before giving any notification 
under section 87(2) of the Act of 1992 indicating the manner in 
which it proposes to determine the application, consult with the 
Member State concerned – 

(a) 

(b) 

regarding, inter alia, the potential transboundary 
effects of 
the measures 
envisaged to reduce or eliminate such effects, 
and 

the project and 

for 
the purposes of making arrangements, 
including the establishment of time-frames for 
consultations, to – 

(i) make available within a reasonable time to 
the authorities referred to in Article 6(1) 
of the EIA Directive, and the members of 
the public concerned, in the territory of

affected, 
in 
paragraphs (a) to (e) (other than paragraph 
(d)(iv)) of Regulation 5, 

information specified

opinion on 
information made

the 

to enable the members of the public

decision-making 
the 
procedure.”, 

environmental

by the insertion of the following paragraphs after paragraph (5): 

“(5A) Where 

the Minister receives 

information under

received. 

(5B) Where the Agency receives a notification from the 
Minister referred to in paragraph (5A) or receives information 
referred to in that paragraph from another Member State of the

State concerned- 

(a) 

(b) 

regarding, inter alia, the potential transboundary 
effects of 
the measures 
envisaged to reduce or eliminate such effects, 
and 

the project and 

for 
the purposes of making arrangements, 
including the establishment of time-frames for

title: and 89 (inserted by section 15 of the Protection of the Environment Act 2003
heading: 10. Regulation 16 of the Principal Regulations is amended -
text_raw:
10. Regulation 16 of the Principal Regulations is amended - 

(a) 

in paragraph (1) - 

(i) 

by the insertion of “and” at the end of subparagraph (m), 
and 

(ii) by the deletion of subparagraph (n), 

(b) by the substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph (3): 

“(3) Where an environmental impact assessment report is 
received in respect of an application for a licence in 
accordance with any provision of Part II, the Agency shall 
notify each authority, person or body to which it has given 
notice under paragraph (1) that - 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

the environmental impact assessment report 
submitted to the Agency in accordance with 
section 83(2A)(d) of the Act of 1992, 

any information provided to the Agency under 
paragraph (e) or (f)(ii)(II) of section 83(2A) of 
the Act of 1992, 

any opinion issued by the Agency under section 
83(2A)(de) of the Act of 1992 on the scope of 
the environmental impact assessment report, 
and, 

any further information, including reports and 
advice, relating to the environmental impact 
assessment as may be furnished to the Agency 

 
 
 [190] 9 

in the course of the Agency’s consideration of 
the application, 

shall each be made available on the Agency’s website, and that 
submissions may be made in writing to the Agency in relation to 
the likely effects on the environment of the proposed activity 
within the period specified by the Agency on its website under 
Regulation 4(2)(c).”, 

(c) 

by the insertion of the following paragraph after paragraph (3): 

“(4) The notification by the Agency referred to in paragraph 
(3) shall indicate the name of the planning authority to which 
the environmental impact assessment report referred to in that 
paragraph has been submitted.”. 

 
 
 
 10 [190] 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

27 May, 2020. 

RICHARD BRUTON, 

Minister for Communication, Climate Action 
and Environment.
